item.title: Report E-2024060113
item.description:
Report E-2024060113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T00:45:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: CREOLA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 4
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL AT CONSIGNEE LOCATION OFFLOADING OPERATIONS STARTED. DUE TO A SLIGHT LEAK AT THE EXTERNAL VALVE CONNECTION CONSIGNEE PERSONEL REJECTED LOAD REQUIRING REPAIR AT OFF-SITE LOCATION. DRIVER PROCEEDED TO REPAIR FACILITY FOR ASSISTANCE. AT EVENT LOCATION, CTMV WAS BROUGHT TO DOORWAY OF REPAIR FACILITY DUE TO WEATHER CONDITIONS. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ASSIST MECHANICS BY REMOVING EXTERNAL VALVE FROM HOUSING. ONCE VALVE REMOVED FROM PIPE PRODUCT FLOWED FREELY INTO ENVIROMENT. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ACTUATE EMERGENCY SHUTOFF. ACTIVATION OF EMERGENCY SHUTOFF FAILED TO STOP FLOW OF PRODUCT. FACILITY EVACUATED DUE TO PRODUCT RELEASE AND INABILITY TO HAULT FLOW FROM TRAILER. VAPOR CLOUD RESULTED FROM PRODUCT FUMES AND WET WEATHER AT TIME OF INCIDENT. DRIVER SUFFERED CHEMICAL BURNS DURING ATTEMPT TO REMOVE VALVE AND HAULT FLOW, WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL. INTERNAL INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY CAUSE OF FAILURE AT THIS POINT APPEARS TO BE INTERNAL VALVE SEATING WHICH PREVENTED PROPER OPERATION OF INTERNAL VALVE SEALING VESSEL. SUPPLIMENTAL REPORT WILL BE FILED WITH ADDITIONAL DETAILS.

item.title: Report X-2024081589
item.description:
Report X-2024081589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/19/2024 at approximately 2100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3667328 at the station in Portland, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of a polystyrene package, containing various food items packed on wet ice, along with two plastic containers of "Multi-Clor". The outer packaging appeared to colapse under the weight, exposing the shipment's contents. An online safety data sheet, retrieved by Dangerous Goods Administration, classified "Multi-Clor" as UN 1791 Hypochlorite solution. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it was not completed with the required markings, labeling, packaging or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024081608
item.description:
Report X-2024081608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA with visible leakage and a strong odor. Upon further inspection it is revealed that the drum had a loose lid/ seal failure leading to the spill, we believed it to be non hazardous at first. We had to reach out to the shipper to get the SDS which caused the initial delay in the DPR, however when provided the transport section did not have any information about it being hazardous, but we suspected it being hazardous because of the SDS chemical composition as well as the GHS classifications listed. We processed the DPR and ISF and asked for an updated SDS from the shipper and the delay from then to filling out an incident report was because the shipper sent us an SDS with the transport information today, however the SDS itself seems to have some conflicting items as it is classified as non hazardous but a UN#, class, as well as packing group were provided right below , it also has acute toxicity NFPA label and a skull and crossbones GHS label but no other information in the transport section about them. The proper shipping name I entered is what I found on the ERG however one was not provided on the SDS. I will include both SDS's for reference.

  • Description: Yard personnel reported ice buildup on the exterior of the protective housing and a strong odor behind the car. Code 3, contractor, was dispatched and upon arrival found the liquid valve open and the plug less than tool tight, resulting in liquid spraying out and freezing. A large chunk of ice was noted on the valve and housing walls. The valve was closed, the plug retefloned and then properly secured with no other issues found. The car continued in transportation after the ice melted off.

The leak was not evident during the loading process or on the post-trip inspection on 7/25/24. The leak was identified while the drum was still on the trailer on 7/26/24. The spill was cleaned up by in-house staff and the original container was overpacked along with the spill clean up residual.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Wet package was brought to QA. No inner packaging materials found. 2 plastic bottles capable of containing 2.5 liquid gallons of Ethanolamine were in the fiberboard box. Exterior applicable markings for being HAZMAT with UN2735, amines, liquid, corrosive, n.o.s., (Ethanolamine), 8, PG II, 46lbs, 1 box, corrosive, and included directional arrows. 1 of 2 plastic bottles Ethanolamine leaked due to loose cap. Only exterior packaging was damaged. No other clean up was necessary, and remaining product placed into appropriate salvage drum. Package is awaiting further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024080572
item.description:
Report E-2024080572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 20, 2024, at 1040 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Livermore, California regarding the release of f ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 3 gallons of ZEP Morado Super Cleaner 20GL (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) 20-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 26ft x 2ft area of the trailer floor and a 12ft x 1ft area of concrete beneath the trailer. The damaged drum of residual product was placed in a 55-gallon overpack with absorbents. Contractors then neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 55-gallon DF overpack and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080557
item.description:
Report E-2024080557

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 19, 2024, at 1617 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Union Gap, Washington regarding the release of Transchem Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 2 gallons of Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid Solution, 8, II) from a box containing (4) 1-gallon plastic pails. The release was due to a load shift and impacted a 6ft x 6ft area on the trailer floor and the outer boxes of other cargo. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Thirty-four 1-gallon plastic pails of recovered product were collected and containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF’s. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 55-gallon DF, then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

THE FOUR GALLONS WERE THEN PLACED IN A GENEROUS LAYER OF ZEPZORB AND SUBMITTED AS A LIQUID SINCE WE HAD OVER 3 GALLONS OF LIQUID.

item.description:
Report E-2024080580

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the transfer of a 551A1 container filled with liquid, oil-based white paint (overpacked into an 851H2) from the customer's storage facility to a Veolia box truck, an incident occurred. As the drum, weighing over 600 pounds, was being positioned onto a pallet inside the Veolia box truck, a leak was detected. To prevent the drum from slipping and potentially injuring personnel, it was promptly secured on the pallet. However, approximately one gallon of the waste material escaped from the drum, contaminating both the pallet and the box truck's floor. The cause of the leak remains unclear, as the drum's position did not seem to be a contributing factor. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the inner container was missing its bung, which may have played a role in the unexpected release of the waste material.

item.title: Report E-2024080562
item.description:
Report E-2024080562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 13, 2024, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN17914 was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected one (1) 30-gallon pail of hypochlorite solution into one (1) 55-gallon over pack poly drum. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the hypochlorite solution and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. On August 19, 2024, EWI returned to the site to process the request to transfer the hypochlorite solution material into a closed top drum. EWI transferred the hypochlorite solution from the damaged 30-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-10ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that approximately one-hundred and fifteen (115) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and placed the recovered spent absorbents into six (6) 40-gallon poly drums and three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor's demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnivroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Upon arrival, ES was notified that personnel for R+L carriers had deployed granular absorbents to the trailer interior and had station the damaged pail on the dock floor. ES personnel began by placing the damaged product pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum. They then utilized absorbent rags to clean and neutralize the dock floor. All spent absorbents were then placed into the same 55-gallon drum as the product pail.

  • Description: On August 8, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of printer ink were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE placed all damaged product into 55-gallon waste drums. The pallet carrying the freight was cut up and placed into waste drums. Granular absorbents and hand tools were utilized to remediate the site. All spent absorbents, damaged product, and the impacted pallet were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums

  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one hundred and fifty (150) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. The remaining product was transferred to a new poly tote and deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used granular absorbents. The spent material was recovered and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

They put the trailer into containment and put down some absorbents to collect the material. The response team was called and showed up at 1545ct to begin the clean-up. the team dawned the proper PPE and began and found that the bottom of the drum had a small hole due to the drum was rusted. The crew then proceeded to place the damaged drum into a salvage drum and the material was cleaned up and the absorbent were disposed of in the proper manner. The clean up was completed at 1800ct.

  • City: Avon
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 30th, 2024, at 09:48, personnel at the CSXT Avon Terminal, Avon Indiana, discovered UTLX 950697, a residue tank car which last contained Butadienes, Stabilized, leaking from the vapor. The car was isolated and the shipper was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-07-30-00096). CSX Hazardous Material Team Managers found the source of cause of release was the vapor line valve not fully closed and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. It was also noted that two other secondary securement plugs were less than tool tight. CSX personnel closed the valve and properly secured all secondary closures. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Tim B. Langford, Shell Chemical, 504-208-8193)

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/21/2024 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 9327095 at the Ground facility in Fairfield, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of four (4) 1-gallon containers packaged together in one fiberboard box. The package appeared damp on its topside. Further investigation revealed the inner containers, marked to match the label on the outside of the package, identifying the commodity as Xylenes, a fully regulated dangerous goods commodity. The shipment adorned no other markings, labeling, or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report X-2024081407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: OXNARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Patrick Mier CHECKER/DRIVER REG called safety to report a HazMat spill in trailer 556479 UN2692, BORON TRIBROMIDE, 8 (6.1), PG I, POISON-INHALATION HAZARD ZONE B. Patrick stated he found the 4lbs box in the nose of the trailer and stated it looked like the box was crushed by other freight in transit . Patrick stated he was not to sure if the product was still in the container in the box or if it had leaked out in the trailer. Safety advised Patrick to stay clear of the box and the trailer until a team could arrive to assist with the spill. Patrick stated the trailer was empty and the box was on e of the last of the freight on the trailer. Patrick stated he set the box down on the table outside the trailer and will send a photo to safety. Patrick stated he does not know if anything in on the trailer floor and did not feel comfortable going back in the trailer.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: During sort operations at the MSPA location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a glass bottle packaged with styrofaom molds top and bottom. The glas bottle was broken and all contents spilled inside of the fiberboard box. A packing slip inside identified the contents as dimethyl sulfoxide as a UN2810. There were no DG markings or paperwork on the outside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

PACKAGE WAS RETAINED BY CUSTOMS UNTIL UPS WORLDPORT RESPONDED TO THE IMPORT INSPECT AREA DUE TO THE CUSTOMS AGENT DISCOVERY OF THE UNDECLARED PRODUCTS ON 18-AUGUST-24. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, UPS DISCOVERED (20) FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CLASSIFIED AS 4.3 DANGEROUS WHEN WET. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 7V077R, GAIN COSMETIC CO LTD, RM 201, 9, YONGGOK-RO 20BEON-GIL, YANGJI-MYEON, YONGIN 17161 SOUTH KOREA.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, ONE BLACK SHRINKED WRAPPED WOODEN SKID SHIPPING AIR CARGO SERVICE TO COLOMBIA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS. DURING THE SCREENING PROCESS WHILE CUTTING THE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING, SEVERAL BOXES WERE FOUND WITH CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. OTHER BOXES WERE FOUND WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS OF THESE BOXES FOUND NUMEROUS FLAMMABLE PERFUMERY PRODUCTS. THE FREIGHT WAS OFFERED FOR AIR TRANSPORTATION TO UPS AIR CARGO WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING. THERE WAS NO INDICATION ON THE AIR WAYBILL THAT DANGEROUS GOOD PRODUCTS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENT NAME AND CITY ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS ALSEATRANS US, 1665 NW 102ND AV, SUITE 108, MIAMI FL, 33172, US. THE SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS MSL INTL GROUP, LLC, 1665 NW 102ND AV, MIAMI FL US.

item.title: Report E-2024080503
item.description:
Report E-2024080503

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: USPS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS. OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH SEVERAL AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT OF THE BOX. IT APPEARS THE CAPS OF ONE OR MORE OF THE AEROSOL CANS HAD COME OFF EXPOSING AND ENGAGING THE NOZZLE RELEASING THE PRODUCT INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE BEGAN TO DETERIORATE AND ULTIMATELY BROKE OPEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER USPS BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE TRAILERED INTO THE UPS ROCKFORD FACLITY AND WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING PRIOR TO FLIGHT ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024080515
item.description:
Report E-2024080515

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a loose lid on one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The loose lid was hand tightened and wiped clean with absorbent rags and then shipped onto the consignee. Clean Habor's personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and the spent absorbents were gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with some impacted cardboard and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report I-2024080073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: FORT LAUDERDALA
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer in 36F Approached the aft lav and informed us that his cell phone charging unit battery"had expanded and broke out of the case". I asked him to bring it to us while I retrieved the TCB. He brought it to the cdt galley where FA Vanak took pictures and went to the front to share them with the purser and captain. I placed the unit temporarily in the TCB without breaking the seal awaiting further instructions and checking the eFAOM. The unit was not hot or Ieaking. The Captain looked at the pictures and advised us to place in the TCB and monitor. I did so for the remaining 40 mins or so. We returned the battery to the passenger upon deplaning and advised him to dispose of it properly. We were advised by MX that since we did not need to break the seal on the zipper Of the TCB it could be returned to its stowed position.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/7/2024 1 pallet of UN 1789 Hydrochloric Acid(Muriatic Acid) was sitting in the SEFL BTR OS&D Bay. The pallet containing 84 boxes with 2 each 1 gallon bottles inside collapsed& fell over. The pallet collapsing caused an estimated 10 gallons to spill on the dock. The spill was contained by dock associates. SEFL Safety was contacted, and contacted Hazmat 1 spill response. E3/OMI arrived on site at approximately 9:15. The team accessed the situation& proceeded with the clean up process. Clean up was complete at approximately 13:30. In total 10-55 gallon drums were used to contain the waste.E3/OMI will return to pick up the waste drums at a later date, once approval has been received.

  • Description: On August 6, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon jugs of UN2922 were punctured on the bottom and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior, pallet, and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents and neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All impacted absorbents were collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged jugs were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024081406
item.description:
Report X-2024081406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: READING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell contacted safety to report that trailer 572156 caught on fire while on the 241/RDG yard. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell stated that after ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck arrived at 241/RDG the lead trailer 572156 started smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry S chreck advised that after he arrived at 241/RDG he was about to unhook his set when he noticed the lead trailer 572156 was smoking. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that he then proceeded to disconnect rear trailer 500713 and converter gear 71708 from the lead trailer. ABF Road Driver Terry Sch reck advised that he then proceeded to move trailer 572156 to the middle of the yard before he disconnected the trailer from tractor 13383. ABF Road Driver Terry Schreck advised that after he disconnected trailer 572156 from the tractor the Reading Fire Department arrived on scene. Deputy Chief Glor e of the Reading Fire Department advised that he believes a pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries shifted during transit. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the battery post may have contacted metal causing them to arc igniting a pallet of writing pens that were incased in carboard that was loaded underneath the pallet of Lithium Ion Batteries. Deputy Chief Glore advised that the Reading Fire Department was able to put the fire out and made sure no drains or waterways were impacted. Operations Supervisor I Nathan ODonnell advised he will send photos of the damage to safety. Safety contacted CURA and sp oke with Cameron Kerr to conduct cleanup procedures.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23,2024, TAG inspected trailer MCKZ550219, booking SEA 1040763. This load sailed NB on the North Star voyage 24115 that departed Tacoma on 7/19/2024. Upon inspecting it, TAG found an undeclared hazardous item of 1 box of UN 1090 Acetone Class flammable liquid not marked as limited quantity. The trailer was placarded as limited quantity and should have been placarded as Class 3. This item not being manifested could cause the trailer to be stowed not according to the proper segregation requirements. The trailer sailed with undeclared hazardous material inside and was stowed on the Vessel.

item.title: Report I-2024070103
item.description:
Report I-2024070103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEMONT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer was loaded at Rowell in Willow Springs on 06/20/2024 with hydrochloric acid 28% and parked for the next day's delivery. On 6/21/2024, driver went to make delivery to customer in University Park, IL. Driver could not get valves to open due to an issue with the air switches not fully opening the internal valve. This is when the trailer was brought to B&R for repairs. When the driver arrived at B&R he stopped and went into the office to check the trailer in, he came out and found HCL leaking from the pump cabinet onto the ground. Driver immediately went to seek out the source of the leak he found it to be leaking from a flange in the piping from the internal valve to the pump. He stopped the leak and began the neutralization process and reported it the repair shop. The repair shop helped the driver to neutralize the spill and clean it up. Driver estimated 5-8 gallons of hydrochloric acid 28% was lost. Trailer's leak was stopped, and the trailer was brought to a contained area to be pumped out. Once the trailer was emptied it was washed out and brought in for necessary repairs. It was found the secondary and internal valve failed. It was also found the flange gasket from the internal to the pump was the incorrect material.

  • Description: On 8/15/2024 at approxmately 1250, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3646245 at the station location in Bedford Heights, reporting a dangerous goods material spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing 1 metal can. The shipment arrived at the destination station, emitting a slight odor. Further inspection revealed that one the packages in the shipment had slightly spilled from the closure. The entire shipment is being held for pick-up by the reciepient.

item.title: Report E-2024080500
item.description:
Report E-2024080500

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and estimated that approximately five (5) gallons of material released due to five (5) 5-gallon metal pails that were crushed during transit. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and collected the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The five (5) damaged pails were placed into five 10-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081307
item.description:
Report X-2024081307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A PUNGENT ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A SINGLE CURROGATED DIVIDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

Spillage released heat.) when attempting to remove package from IC belt. Package Handler Trainer Justin Hoeh had minor corrosion to undersides of shoes. Upon recommendation of Hoeh and Hall (DGNav reporter), the Work Area Manager ensured Bowers rinsed his hands for 10-15 min and continued follow up. Safety specialists have been notified.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC unit was traveling on Route 7 in Ferrisburgh, Vermont. It is suspected that a fire started in one of the rear wheels on the tractor that quickly spread to the trailer. Due to the fire and heat, the trailer began to vent the natural gas it was holding. The local fire department was eventually able extinguish the fire. The tractor and trailer suffered significant damage as a result of the fire.

item.title: Report I-2024080044
item.description:
Report I-2024080044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: LAKE HAVASU CITY
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ECOLOGY CONTROL INDUSTRIES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11th, 2024 I drove a load from Marathon Refinery in Carson, CA to Foreman, AR. When I reached Lake Havasa, AZ it was a temperature of 125 degrees F. I reached the truck stop Pilots in Lake Havasa to take a 30 minute break and did a trailer inspection on the trailer 1145. I noticed the trailer was leaking the product out of the top of the tank. I rushed to grab some trash cans that the truck stop had next to my trailer to catch any liquid that was draining down the side of the tank. I climbed up the ladder to inspect where the leak was coming from and noticed it was leaking from the ARV Valve and also had 40 PSI of pressure and nowhere to relieve the pressure from. I cleaned up the tank and kept an eye on it and waited for temps to cool down. Once the temps cooled down I was able to relieve the pressure from the domes by cracking one of the ears. All the pressure was relieved and the leak stopped and was contained until the HAZMAT team showed up at 0900 in the morning to clean up.

item.title: Report X-2024081248
item.description:
Report X-2024081248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2024081213

item.title: Report X-2024081224
item.description:
Report X-2024081224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: Waterloo
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central And Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17910
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Monday, August 5, 2024, a CN mechanical performing an inspection observed that the bottom outlet valve appeared to be leaking from tank car # FURX 160111 along with a strong Ethanol type odor in the area. The employee notified the Waterloo Yard Master who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car was set out to an isolation track (WA60) for inspection by a CN emergency response contractor. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The contractor performed an inspection of the tank car and found the bottom outlet valve to be leaking from the threads of the bottom outlet valve cap. It was determined that there was a failure in the sealing surface of the valve seat to include a defective gasket. (The BOV cap was found to be less than tool tight and the BOV in the closed position and pinned upon initial inspection). CN emergency response contractor did observe cable seal to be correctly in place. The BOV cap was removed, and it was observed to be leaking past the closed ball. The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to free any debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing the leak. The BOV cap was then removed and observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. It was noted that the BOV cap gasket was deformed and was replaced. The bottom outlet valve cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench. Upon tightening the BOV cap, CN emergency response contractor proceeded to place new cable seals on the BOV / Cap.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1789 Transchem Muriatic Acid from several boxes of (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the pallet/packaging only located on the dock. The bottles appeared to be leaking from the caps as a result of expansion caused by heat. The leaking jugs were collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All impacted cardboard was neutralized and containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
